channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12787] Backport HBASE-12028 (Abort the RegionServer when it's handler threads die) to 0.98
item.description:
Backport HBASE-12028 (Abort the RegionServer when it's handler threads die) to 0.98. There are two 0.98-specific changes that should be addressed:

  1. The default configuration should preserve current behavior
  2. The interface change to RpcSchedulerFactory should be binary compatible for Phoenix if possible, and we can do this by detecting with reflection if an older implementation of the interface is missing the new 'create' method and by invoking the older deprecated 'create' method instead. We can cache the decision after making it once.
item.summary: Backport HBASE-12028 (Abort the RegionServer when it's handler threads die) to 0.98

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Comment on dev@hbase from Alicia Shu:

If we would like to port this change to 0.98, another option is not changing RpcSchedulerFactory, but add a SET method for RpcScheduler that set the Abortable afterwards. Thus there will be no backward compatible issue. New code need to know to call the SET method. Old code will have a null abortable.
See PHOENIX-1569 for detecting if/when an incompatible Phoenix and HBase jar are in use.
Andrew Purtell I can work on this.
Thanks, assigned

From Ted Yu on dev@hbase:

In RSRpcServices, this (RSRpcServices) is passed to the create method:
rpcSchedulerFactory.create(rs.conf, this));

RSRpcServices has reference to HRegionServer.

If RSRpcServices implements Abortable and delegates to regionServer,
RpcSchedulerFactory.create() would obtain the Abortable.

Just my two cents.
I'd like to have a RC for 0.98.10 out by Jan 12th and this change in it. Will that be a problem? If so I can pick it up. Let me know.
Attached the patch for hbase 0.98.

This looks good if the test works and Phoenix can compile with this except for two things:

  • Formatting. You should use 2 spaces for all patches. You can change your eclipse settings for that for future.
  • In 0.98 I think we should default to 0 for the setting , meaning this is disabled by default. We can keep it enabled by default for 1.0 and master.
Everything Enis said then +1 from me
Changed the format and made default to -1 to disable aborting RS by default. Reattached patch.

public interface RpcSchedulerFactory {

/**

  • Constructs a {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcScheduler}

    .
    *

  • Please note that this method is called in constructor of {@link HRegionServer}

    , so some

  • fields may not be ready for access. The reason that {@code HRegionServer} is passed as
    * parameter here is that an RPC scheduler may need to access data structure inside
    * {@code HRegionServer}

    (see example in

    {@link SimpleRpcSchedulerFactory}

    ).
    */
    RpcScheduler create(Configuration conf, RegionServerServices server);
    }

RegionServerServices already extends Abortable. There is no interface change in 0.98 for this feature.

Thanks Alicia. Sorry, you have to change the default in hbase-common/src/main/resources/hbase-default.xml as well. That takes precedence over the one in code.

When Configuration. getDouble(String key, double defaultValue) is called, it will respond from the value in hbase-site.xml first, if not found hbase-default.xml second. If both does not contain it will default to the defaultValue passed.
Thanks. Enis. Good catch. Reattached the patch with -1 in hbase-default.xml.
Great, let me double check compilation against Phoenix and commit this in a bit.

Phoenix compiles and unit tests pass also.

There is a repeatable, probably unrelated, test failure that I'm looking into before proceeding.

All RPC tests pass on latest branch 0.98 head with this applied.

Pushed.

Thanks for the nice backport!

[ERROR] /home/apurtell/src/hbase/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/RpcExecutor.java:[122,33] error: cannot find symbol
Attaching addendum I committed to fix the Hadoop 1 build. Tested with Hadoop 1 and 2 builds.

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
This change adds the site configuration property "hbase.regionserver.handler.abort.on.error.percent". This is the percent of region server RPC threads that can fail before a regionserver is aborted, and can have one of the following values:
- -1 Disable aborting (default)
- 0 Abort if even a single handler has died
- 0.x Abort only when this percent of handlers have died
- 1 Abort only all of the handers have died
